acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 2 from 48 hours LC50=1.12mg/L of the crustacea (Daphnia magna) (AQUIRE (2008)).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Classification is not possible because there is no data. In addition, EU classification of 3,4-Dichloroaniline (CAS No.95-76-1) which is a constitutional isomer is T;23/24/25 (EU-Annex I).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Classification is not possible because there is no data. In addition, EU classification of 3,4-Dichloroaniline (CAS No.95-76-1) which is a constitutional isomer is T;23/24/25 (EU-Annex I).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Since it was a solid by the definition of GHS and inhalation in gas was not assumed, it was classified into "Not applicable".

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Classification is not possible because there is no data. In addition, EU classification of 3,4-Dichloroaniline (CAS No.95-76-1) which is a constitutional isomer is T;23/24/25 (EU-Annex I).

aspiration_hazard.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

carcinogenicity.rationale: Since no evaluation by major international evaluation agencies is made and there is no data, classification is not possible.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since acute toxicity was Category 2 and there were no rapid degradability (BIOWIN), it was classified into Category 2.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available.

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

flammable_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Although there is a description of "negative" in the reverse mutation test employing Salmonella typhimurium (NTP DB (Access on December 2008)) as an in vitro examination, classification is not possible because there is no data of in vivo examination. In addition, also refer to the classification of 3,4-Dichloroaniline (CAS No.95-76-1) which is a constitutional isomer.

organic_peroxides.rationale: The organic compound not including peroxy group in molecule.

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Although it is an organic compound including chlorine, not fluorine and oxygen, chlorine has bound only to carbon.

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Even if it contacts the normal temperature air, it does not ignite spontaneously (ignition temperature 620degC (Merck KGaA data from March 2009)).

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

respiratory_sensitizer.rationale: Classification is not possible since there is no data.

self_heating_substances.rationale: The test method applicable for substances becoming liquid or gas at 140degC of test temperature has not been established.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Classification is not possible because there is no data. In addition, the EU classification of 3, 4-Dichloroaniline (CAS No.95-76-1) which is a constitutional isomer is Xi; R41 (EU-Annex I).

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

skin_sensitizer.rationale: Classification is not possible since there is no data. In addition, 3- and 3,4-Dichloroaniline (CAS No.95-76-1) which are constitutional isomers can be classified as R43 (EU-AnnexI) in the European Union classification.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At) are not included.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Classification is not possible because there is no data. See also the classification of its constitutional isomers, 2,5-Dichloroaniline (CAS No. 95-82-9) and 3, 4-Dichloroaniline (CAS No. 95-76-1).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs (blood system)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: HSDB (2003) which is the information source of List2 has a description of "central cyanosis, headache, fatigue, syncope, difficulty breathings, central nervous system depression, a shock", and "the increases of methemoglobin values and effect of this reduction of transport of blood oxygen rate", etc. Moreover, as for constitutional isomers, there is a description that "2,4-, 2,5-, 3,4-Dichloroaniline are methemoglobin formation substances like other Chloroaniline, and show an acute condition by methemoglobinemia" (BUA 140 (Summary 1993)), and this article was also classified into Category 2 (blood systems) since the effects by methemoglobinemia was taken into consideration.
